description:
One day Kagami Kazuya, an ordinary boy, encounters Kiriha, a beautiful girl in a kimono. It turns out Kiriha is a tsukumogami, a spirit, whose true identity is the precious obi Kazuya carries around as a memory of his late mother. All kinds of bizarre things unfold in this supernatural action comedy!

(Source: Funimation)
synonyms: สึกุโมโมะ ภูตสาวแสบดุ

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Youkai
tags.description: Prominently features supernatural creatures from Japanese folklore.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Gods
tags.description: Prominently features a character of divine or religious nature.

tags.name: Primarily Child Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters below a high school age.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Bisexual
tags.description: Features a character who is romantically or sexually attracted to people of more than one sex or gender.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Age Regression
tags.description: Prominently features a character who was returned to a younger state.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

node.description: Date of Birth: March 30, 1996 Birthplace: Okinawa City, Okinawa Prefecture, Japan Website | Twitter | Instagram Introduction Touyama Michiko (當山美智子), also known by her stage name MICHI (ミチ) is a Japanese singer under record label Pony Canyon. Biography Produced by Elements Garden, Michi began her career with her debut single, “Cry for the Truth/Secret Sky”, which served as the opening and ending theme songs to the anime television series Rokka: Braves of the Six Flowers. She has released two other singles of which her song "Checkmate!?" peaked at #51. This song was used as the opening song to Dagashi Kashi. Her third single, "Realistic!", was used as the first ending theme to the anime Kuromukuro. She released her first album called "Sprint for the Dreams" on September 21, 2016. Michi was a guest at the 2016 Anime Expo, and was a guest at Otakon 2016. Her song "I4U" was used as the ending theme to the 2017 anime television series Tsugumomo. Her song "Soranetarium" (ソラネタリウム) was used as the opening theme to the 2018 anime television series The Girl in Twilight. (Source: en.wikipedia.org)

__Founded:__ 2015

__[Artist Profile (TOY'S FACTORY)](https://www.toysfactory.co.jp/artist/q_mhz)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/QMHz_info)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCUKcdgw725jOdQ6LfQNYZsA)__

name.native: バンドじゃないもん!マックス・ナカヨシ

node.description:
__[Website](https://banmon.jp/) | [Blog (JP)](https://ameblo.jp/bandjanaimon) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/bandjanaimon) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/band_ja_naimon/)__

__Introduction:__
Band Ja Naimon! MAXX NAKAYOSHI, previously known as Band Ja Naimon!, or otherwise abbreviated to BanMon, is a Japanese six member female idol group under record label Pony Canyon (2016–), affiliated with entertainment agency Perfect Music. They were previously under record labels Warner Music Japan (2012–2013) and Space Shower Music (2014–2015).

__Members:__
- [Misako Suzuki](https://twitter.com/SKCmisako) (鈴姫みさこ) – drummer
- [Ringo Koishio](https://twitter.com/sioringogo) (恋汐りんご) – percussionist, castanets
- [Gumi Nanase](https://twitter.com/gumi_nanase) (ななせぐみ) – hand percussionist, shaker
- [Miyu Mochizuki](https://twitter.com/myc416) (望月みゆ) – bassist
- [Yuzu Amanatsu](https://twitter.com/yuzu_amanatsu) (甘夏ゆず) – synthesizer
- [Sunrise Omomoko](https://twitter.com/chanmomochan10) (大桃子サンライズ) – tingsha player

__[Blog (JP)](https://ameblo.jp/nocty-x-rucca/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/mizoguchi_rucca)__

__Birthplace:__ Kanagawa Prefecture, Japan

__Introduction:__
Takanori Mizoguchi, alternatively known by stage name RUCCA, is a Japanese lyricist and novelist. 

__Trivia:__
- He uses the name Mizoguchi Takanori (溝口貴紀) mainly when providing material to artists and idols.
- The name RUCCA is mainly used when providing material to the animation and games industry, but was also used once during a special occasion.
- The name L(R)UCCA) used mainly in context, or relation to record label _pure: infinity_, where he provides material for four-piece rock band 100% FREE
- The last name 溝口RUCCA is used as his pen-name when writing novels.

(Source: [Wikipedia (JP)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%BA%9D%E5%8F%A3%E8%B2%B4%E7%B4%80), edited)
Twitter | Website (artist page) __Seima Iwahashi__ is a Japanese composer, arranger, director and orechestrator. He is a member of the music production team, Elements Garden.
Fujima Hitoshi is a composer and arranger.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/romanovh) | [Hatena Blog](https://romanovhiga.hateblo.jp/) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/418723) | [note](https://note.com/romanovh/)

Romanov Higa, born Kazuhiro Higa, is one of the leading 3DCG animation artists in Japan. He graduated The University of Electro-Communications in Tokyo, Japan in 1996.

In 1997, his work "ONE DAY, SOME GIRL" won the Grand Prix at the 9th Amateur CG Animation Contest organized by Project Team DoGA. In 1999, he joined video game publisher Namco, but left only a few years later in 2001. He then started working freelance, mostly working on his own original movies. In recent years, his work has mostly been either storyboarding or within the art department of video games, and have notably been working on several titles in the *Pokémon* franchise.

**Non-Anime work:**
~!**Gungrave** (VG: PS2) - Movie Direction, Storyboard, Production (OP, ED, some interludes)
**Galaxy Angel** (VG: Windows, PS2, Xbox) - Movie Production (Beginning scene)
**Gungrave OD** (VG: PS2) - Movie Direction, Storyboard, Production (OP, ED, interludes)
**Princess Holiday ~Korogaru Ringotei Sen'ya Ichiya~** (VG: PS2) - Unit Director, Producer (Advertising movie)
**Tsuki wa Higashi ni Hi wa Nishi ni ~Operation Sanctuary~** (VG: Dreamcast, PS2) - Unit Director, Producer (Advertising movie)
**BALDR FORCE EXE** (VG: Dreamcast) - Direction, Storyboard, Production (Intermission movies)
**BALDR FORCE EXE** (VG: PS2) - Unit Director, Producer (Advertising movie)
**Tenkabito** (VG: PS2) - Storyboard (Interlude movie)
**BALDR BULLET EQUILIBRIUM** (VG: PS2) - Unit Director, Producer (Advertising movie)
**Pokémon Sun & Moon** (VG: 3DS) - Storyboard Design
**Pokémon Ultra Sun & Ultra Moon** (VG: 3DS) - Storyboard Design, Scenario Movie Graphics
**Pokémon Let's Go, Pikachu! & Let's Go, Eevee!** (VG: Switch) - Storyboard Design, Scenario Movie Graphic Design
**Pokémon Sword & Shield** (VG: Switch) - Movie Graphic Design
**New Pokémon Snap** (VG: Switch) - Movie Direction
**Pokémon Legends: Arceus** (VG: Switch) - Cinematic Design Team!~

[Twitter](https://x.com/Masaaki_Sakurai)

_Note: Not to be confused with the late [scriptwriter](https://anilist.co/staff/161497/)._

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/corporate_x) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/越智博之)

Specializes in mechanical animation. Currently affiliated with [Zero-G](https://anilist.co/studio/6117/).

Attended an art school before joining studio Bevore. Long-time friend of [Naoyuki Onda](https://anilist.co/staff/102427/)'s, who worked with him at the studio. Participated on numerous of AIC's projects in the late '80s and early '90s.

Debuted as a director with [Armitage](https://anilist.co/anime/1079/) in 1995.
